About.title: Contributors and users

About.title: About the STACK logo
About.description: Read about the mathematics behind the STACK logo.

About.title: About the STACK Project
About.description: STACK is an assessment system for mathematics, science and related disciplines designed to enable students to answer questions with a mathematical expression.

AbInitio.title: Quick start for new users - STACK Documentation
AbInitio.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with multipart questions.

AbInitio.title: Authoring Quick Start - STACK Documentation
AbInitio.description: The authoring quick start is a great place to start learning about using STACK. This step-by-step guide will teach you to create a basic question in STACK.

AbInitio.title: Authoring Quick Start 2 - STACK Documentation
AbInitio.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with question variables, including a simple integration problem.

AbInitio.title: Authoring Quick Start 3 - STACK Documentation
AbInitio.description: The third part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with improving feedback, including the Int and FacForm answer tests.

AbInitio.title: Authoring Quick Start 4 - STACK Documentation
AbInitio.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with randomisation and deploying variants.

AbInitio.title: Authoring Quick Start 5 - STACK Documentation
AbInitio.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with question tests.

AbInitio.title: Authoring Quick Start 6 - STACK Documentation
AbInitio.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with multipart questions.

AbInitio.title: Authoring Quick Start 7 - STACK Documentation
AbInitio.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start deals with turning simplification off.

AbInitio.title: Authoring Quick Start 8 - STACK Documentation
AbInitio.description: The second part of the STACK authoring quick start shows you how to import and export questions, as well as how to create a Moodle quiz.
